etymologies: mid 17th century (in the sense ‘simpleton’): from obsolete buffle ‘buffalo’ + head. The current sense (mid 18th century) may be an independent formation because of the duck's large square-shaped head

definitions: a small North American diving duck related to the goldeneye, with a large puffy head. The male has white plumage with a black back.
shortDefinitions: small North American diving duck related to goldeneye
